question.content:
A compound microscope contains two lenses. Together, these enable us to look at tiny objects in great detail.

**Which of these describes the purpose of an objective lens of a compound microscope?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: It produces an intermediate image for the eyepiece to magnify.
choices.clue: This is true for the objective of a compound microscope but it ALSO aids in the magnification of the object. Both of them together produce the net magnification.

choices.content: It produces an image of a size bigger than the object.
choices.clue: This is true for the objective of a compound microscope but the image it produces is ALSO an intermediate image for the eyepiece to magnify.

As you can see, the image created by the objective (left) lens is bigger than the object. ALSO, this image is magnified by the eyepiece.
